I have not merged the 3.3 fixes to the file transfer service back up to 4.0.  
When I do, this will be fixed.

Todd -- these file transfer fixes have been merged from 3.3 to 4.0, so this 
should all work again.  Can you please validate with the 4.0 i3 milestone 
driver?

Thanks!

Reopening because 'Test' still doesn't run on z/OS, but fails differently (June 
16th build).  Now the launch just kind of hangs.  Adding 99368 as a dependency 
per Scott S.

Todd, please re-test on the next official build (late Sunday or Monday 
morning, 6/20/2005) and let me know if this doesn't fix the hang.  I do not 
know what is causing the hang -- but I just finished the merge that this 
defect is potentially at same level dependent on, thanks!
-Scott

Just another bit of information that is known but not recorded yet, if the
backend is switched out to the 3.3 RAC then things work as expected.

The ProcessExecutorImpl class calls into the startProcess0 native method and it
fails with a return code of -1.  The test runner Java VM process is never
launched and then the test hangs until an InactiveProcessException occurs.  I am
not sure why the process failure is occuring in the native code yet, the only
thing I see changed in hclaunch.c since 3.3 (into 4.0) is the
convertJavaStringToNative(...) method being used and added to RAComm.c.

So far it appears like this might be a regression in the native code since TPTP
3.3 on z/OS but I cannot confirm this yet.

Okay, the fix is in the native side, libhclaunch.so associated code.  I have
tested with a new libhclaunch.so binary that Samson built and test execution now
runs to completion with test execution results that (just using a quick sanity
check) appear correct.

Re-assigning to Samson per his request so he can code review these changes with
Hendra and/or others on his team.

This is caused by the following:
- incorrectly converted twice the execution command line parameters
- incorrectly converted the "=" and the ":" on the z/OS (from the makefile)
Fix checked into TPTP 4.0 CVS 2005/06/30 3:40pm EDT.

Closing by default since not closed by the originator in the 7+ months since being resolved.  

Please reopen if the issue is still present in the latest TPTP release or the resolution is not correct.
